intro: Chamaesaracha cernua, commonly known as the drooping sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats of foliage. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are usually arranged in a rosette and are covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Chamaesaracha cernua is adapted to harsh environments, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils.
